Parameters¶

class pysip.core.Parameters(parameters, name='')[source]¶

Factory of Parameter instances

Parameters

  • parameters (list) – There is two options for instantiating Parameters: parameters is a list of strings corresponding to the parameters names. In this case all the parameters have the default settings; parameters is a list of dictionaries, where the arguments of Parameter can be modified as key-value pairs

  • name (str) – Name of this specific instance

Notes

Multiple instances of Parameters can be added together

>>> p_alpha = Parameters(['a', 'b', 'c'], name='alpha')
>>> p_beta = Parameters(['c', 'd', 'e'], name='beta')
>>> params = [
    {'name': 'a', 'value': 1.0, 'transform': 'log'},
    {'name': 'b', 'value': 2.0, 'bounds': (1.0, 3.0)},
]
>>> p_gamma = Parameters(parameters=params, name='gamma')
>>> print(p_alpha + p_beta + p_gamma)

Parameters alpha__beta__gamma
* alpha__beta
    * alpha
        name=a value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
        name=b value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
        name=c value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
    * beta
        name=c value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
        name=d value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
        name=e value=0.000e+00 transform=none bounds=(None, None) prior=None
* gamma
    name=a value=1.000e+00 transform=log bounds=(None, None) prior=None
    name=b value=2.000e+00 transform=logit bounds=(1.0, 3.0) prior=None

property eta_jacobian¶

Transform jacobian \(\partial \eta \,/\, \partial \theta\)

\[\frac{\partial \pi(\theta \mid y)}{\partial \theta} = \frac{\partial \pi(\eta \mid y)}{\partial \eta} \frac{\partial \eta}{\partial \theta}\]

where \(\pi(\theta \mid y) = \log p(\theta \mid y)\) is the logarithm of the posterior distribution in the constrained parameter space and, \(\eta = f(\theta)\) is the bijective transformation.

Notes

Only univariate change of variables are supported.

Return type

List

Return the list of free parameters

Return type

List[bool]

property theta¶

Get the constrained parameter values \(\mathbf{\theta}\)

Return type

List

property theta_dlog_jacobian¶

Partial derivative of the logarithm of the jacobian adjustment \(\partial \log \left| \partial \theta \,/\, \partial \eta \right| \,/\, \partial \eta\)

\[\frac{\partial \pi(\eta \mid y)}{\partial \eta} = \frac{\partial \pi(\theta \mid y)}{\partial \theta} \frac{\partial \theta}{\partial \eta} + \frac{\partial}{\partial \eta} \log \left|\frac{\partial \theta}{\partial \eta}\right|\]

where \(\pi(\theta \mid y) = \log p(\theta \mid y)\) is the logarithm of the posterior distribution in the constrained parameter space and, \(\theta = f^{-1}(\eta)\) is the inverse bijective transformation.

Notes

The jacobian adjustment is required if a prior distribution is used. This formula is works for univariate change of variables only. For multivariate case, the absolute value of the determinant of the jacobian matrix must be used.

Return type

List

property theta_free¶

Get constrained parameter values \(\mathbf{\theta}\) which are not fixed

Return type

List

property theta_jacobian¶

Inverse transform jacobian \(\partial \theta \,/\, \partial \eta\)

\[\frac{\partial \pi(\eta \mid y)}{\partial \eta} = \frac{\partial \pi(\theta \mid y)}{\partial \theta} \frac{\partial \theta}{\partial \eta}\]

where \(\pi(\theta \mid y) = \log p(\theta \mid y)\) is the logarithm of the posterior distribution in the constrained parameter space and, \(\theta = f^{-1}(\eta)\) is the inverse bijective transformation.

Notes

Only univariate change of variables are supported.

Return type

List

property theta_log_jacobian¶

Logarithm of the jacobian adjustment \(\log \left| \partial \theta \,/\, \partial \eta \right|\)

\[\pi(\eta \mid y) = \pi(\theta \mid y) + \log \left| \frac{\partial \theta}{\partial \eta} \right|\]

where \(\pi(\theta \mid y) = \log p(\theta \mid y)\) is the logarithm of the posterior distribution in the constrained parameter space and, \(\theta = f^{-1}(\eta)\) is the inverse bijective transformation.

Notes

The jacobian adjustment is required if a prior distribution is used. This formula is works for univariate change of variables only. For multivariate case, the absolute value of the determinant of the jacobian matrix must be used.

Return type

List

property theta_sd¶

Get standardized parameter values \(\mathbf{\theta_{sd}}\) which are not fixed

Return type

List
